Unnamed: 1: Trial Name /Details
Unnamed: 2: Trial Intervention

Unnamed: 1:
DORA (WOO)

Upfront resectable

CA19-9 < 300
Unnamed: 2:
Baseline EUS biopsy

Durvalumab 1500 mg IV x 1 dose and oleclumab 3000 mg x 2 doses Q2W prior to resection]
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion: 
Resectable PDAC by NCCN criteria 
CA 19-9 < 300
Life expectancy ≥ 12 weeks
Exclusion: 
- Anticancer therapy within 21 days or palliative RT within 14 days prior to 1st dose
- Other invasive malignancy within 5 years.
- Prior receipt of any immune-mediated therapy

- Other invasive malignancy within 5 years

-  Prior history of myocardial infarction, transient ischemic attack, congestive heart failure ≥ Class 3 based on New York Heart Association Functional Classification or stroke within the past 3 months prior to the scheduled first dose of study treatment.

- Positve for HIV

Unnamed: 1:
GO44479/ROCHE (Vaccine Study)

Upfront resectable

Randomized study of autogene cevumeran + Atezolizumab + mFOLFIRINOX vs. mFOLFIRINOX alone

CA19-9 < ~500
Unnamed: 2:
Tissue collected at surgery for adjuvant vaccine manufacture 

Arm 1: autogene cevumeran+Atezo+mFOLFIRINOX  

Arm 2: mFOLFIRINOX
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion: 
TNM Staging per AJCC: T1-T3, N0-N2, and M0 
Complete resection (R0 or R1) of PDAC
Interval of between 6 and 12 weeks since resection of PDAC
Exclusion: 
Prior adjuvant, neoadjuvant, or induction treatment for pancreatic cancer
Known complete dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase (DPD) deficiency

Unnamed: 1:
Prosper-PANC Cohort 1

Upfront resectable

Includes DORA and GO44479 patients
Unnamed: 2:
Fresh tissue collection for WGTS + organoids 

Serial blood draws for ctDNA
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion: 
Upfront resectable: definition of resectability will be according to NCCN guidelines and the patient must be planned for a surgery first approach.
Life expectancy of ≥ 6 months
Must be suitable for systemic therapy
Exclusion: 
Histologies excluded: colloid, high grade neuroendocrine
Patients receiving neoadjuvant chemotherapy (neoadjuvant immunotherapy is permitted)

Unnamed: 1:
ABLATE (radiation)

Locally advanced unresectable on 1L chemo for at least 16 weeks with stable disease or partial response 

Ideally pre-chemo biopsy under HPB tissue banking, page CRC to consent to HPB tissue banking prior to chemo
Unnamed: 2:
Pre-radiation biopsy optional 

Ablative high dose RT: 
    50Gy/5Fx or 
    67.5Gy/15Fx or 
    75Gy/25Fx
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion: 
Pancreatic tumour <8.0 cm in greatest axial dimension - final determination  will be based upon satisfying the radiation normal tissue constraints.
Life expectancy > 6 months
Prior 1L chemotherapy for at least 16 weeks without clinical or radiographic progression
Exclusion: 
Metastatic disease at the time of registration
Prior RT to the upper abdomen region that would result in overlap of RT volume
Currently on anti-cancer treatment including chemotherapy.

Unnamed: 1:
NASC-009/NCI 10464

Locally advanced unresectable on 1L chemo for at least 16 weeks without progression
Unnamed: 2:
Cycle 1: Olaparib BID + Durvalumab C1D1 

Cycle 2: Olaparib + Durva + RT (39Gy in 15Fx starting C2D1) 

Cycle 3 onwards: Olaparib + Durva q4w
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion: 
have had prior 1L chemotherapy for this cancer for at least 16 weeks without clinical, biochemical, or radiologic progression
Body weight > 30 kg.
Life expectancy >= 16 weeks.
Willing to provide archived tissue, if available, from a previous biopsy
Exclusion:
Had prior upper abdominal radiotherapy prior to entering the study.
Major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to enrollment.
Patients who are receiving any other investigational agents.
Must not have germline BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutation.

Unnamed: 1:
Prosper-PANC Cohort 2

Unresectable, locally advanced and metastatic PDAC 

At initial diagnosis or at progression – goal is to look for actionable mutations
Unnamed: 2:
Requires fresh tumor biopsy for WGTS + organoids 

Serial blood draws wk 2, 4, 8 and q8 for ctDNA
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion: 
All stages are eligible including locally advanced unresectable, first-line metastatic, second-line (or beyond) metastatic
Single lesion is to be biopsied: a minimum of 4 to 6 x 18 Gauge (G) good quality tumour cores must be safely obtainable.
Exclusion:
Without a tumour lesion amenable to biopsy or with tumour lesions that are not safe for sampling a minimum of 4 to 6 x 18G good quality tumour cores
Patients who are not fit enough to undergo a tumour biopsy

Unnamed: 1:
CLARITY-PanTumour01 - Claudin 18.2

investigate the safety and tolerability of AZD0901 monotherapy in combination with anti-cancer agents in PDAC (1L) in participants with advanced or metastatic solid tumours expressing CLDN18.2 

- Prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy is permitted as long as participants progressed ≥ 6 months (183 days) from the last dose
Unnamed: 2:
Pre-screen: needs archival ( ≤ 24 months) or fresh tissue 

Arm1: AZD0901 in combination with 5FU/leucovorin and Irinotecan or nanoliposomal Irinotecan  

Arm2: AZD0901 combination with Gemcitabine
Unnamed: 3:
Pre-screen:  
Dorian Facey: 437-779-7757 
Rachel Ding: 437-990-4238 


Screen: guillaume.cheung@uhn.ca
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion: 
CLDN18.2 positive
at least one measurable lesion according to RECIST v1.1.
Life expectancy of ≥ 12 weeks.
Exclusion:
Unstable or active peptic ulcer disease or digestive tract bleeding including but not limited to clinically significant bleeding in the setting of prior CLDN18.2 directed therapy.
Clinically significant ascites that require drainage.
History of another primary malignancy.

Unnamed: 1:
20230223 (AMG193) - MTAP Deletion

A Phase 1b Study Evaluating the Safety,
Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Efficacy of
AMG 193 in Combination with mFOLFIRINOX or
with Gemcitabine and Nab-paclitaxel in Subjects with Locally Advanced or Metastatic Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma (PDAC) with Homozygous MTAP-deletion (Subprotocol B)

Prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant therapy is allowed if completed
at least 6 months prior to diagnosis of advanced and/or unresectable disease,
and if subjects did not receive gemcitabine and/or nab-paclitaxel (arm 1) or
any active agent of FOLFIRINOX (arm 2) in the neoadjuvant/adjuvant setting.
Unnamed: 2:
Pre-screen: needs archival or fresh tissue  

AMG 193 alone or in combination with mFOLFIRINOX or with Gemcitabine and Nab-paclitaxel
Unnamed: 3:
Ochir Gansukh
416-946-4501 ext. 4551
ochir.gansukh@uhn.ca 

Maggie Hildebrand : Maggie.Hildebrand@uhn.ca
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion:
ECOG 0-1 
Tumor tissue (FFPE sample) or an archival block must be available. Participants without archived tumor tissue available may be allowed to enroll by undergoing tumor biopsy before dosing.
Homozygous MTAP-deletion
Disease measurable as defined by RECIST v1.1.
Exclusion:
Prior systemic therapy for advanced or unresectable (locally advanced) adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.
Prior treatment with a MAT2A inhibitor or a PRMT5 inhibitor.
Radiation therapy within 28 days of first dose.

Unnamed: 1:
PEGASUS (Glucose Monitoring)

mPDAC patients starting 1L mFFX 

ECOG 0-1 

Adequate bone marrow and organ function 

RECIST measurable disease at BL 

No prior diabetes diagnosis 

HbA1C < 6.5%
Unnamed: 2:
Continuous glucose monitor (CGM) for first 2 months of mFFX 

Arm 1: Intensive glucose intervention with endocrinologist directed glycemic management, with target glucose levels between 4-10 mmol/L 

Arm 2: Standard of care glucose intervention with intervention only if glucose level >15 mmol/L (Blinded to CGM results)
Unnamed: 4:
Exclusion:
Absence of distant or lymph node metastases. Participants with borderline resectable or locally advanced PDAC are not eligible.
Received prior systemic therapy (chemotherapy or any other anti-cancer agent) for treatment of metastatic PDAC
Known diagnosis of type I diabetes where strict glucose control and close Endocrinology follow-up is already indicated.
Known diagnosis of type II diabetes and already followed by Endocrinologist.

Unnamed: 1: OZM-114
Unnamed: 2: Phase 1b Expansion Study of CX-5461 In Patients with Solid Tumors and BRCA2 and/or PALB2 mutation
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion: 
Histologically confirmed pancreatic, ovarian, prostate or breast cancers with pathogenic/likely pathogenic germline BRCA2 and/or PALB2 mutation 
Measurable disease as per RECIST 1.1.
Exclusion:
Patients with malignant bowel obstruction.
Unresolved toxicity > CTCAE grade 1 from previous anti-cancer therapy 
Treatment with an investigational (non-registered - other than PARP inhibitor) agent within 30 days and treatment with PARP inhibitor within 14 days prior to the first dose of study medication
No concurrent systemic anti-cancer therapy, biological therapy or other novel agent is to be permitted.

Unnamed: 1: ADOPT
Unnamed: 2: PDO-directed therapy
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion: 
Advanced, inoperable PDAC
Stable disease or partial response to FOLFIRINOX after ≥4 months (Cohort B)
Disease progression post-SOC (Cohort A)
No max prior treatment lines; recurrence within 6 months of adjuvant-intent chemo eligible
Must have a Patient Derived Organoid (PDO) showing sensitivity to HC Marketed drug(s)
Exclusion:
Patients concurrently receiving any other anti-cancer therapy
Patients with ongoing toxicity ≥ CTCAE grade 2; ongoing
peripheral neuropathy of ≥ CTCAE grade 3.
Patients with a prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural
history or treatment has the potential to interfere with the
safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen.

Unnamed: 2:
Arm VII: dose expansion - randomized 1:1:1 open label to 500 mg/m2 or 625 mg/m2 BOLD-100 in combination with FOLFOX or FOLFOX alone 

BOLD-100: IV ruthenium-based small molecule decreasing GRP78 in tumor cells
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion: 
Histologically and/or cytologically confirmed gastrointestinal tumours that are metastatic or unresectable, and have measurable disease according to RECIST v1.1 (at least one measurable lesion)
ARM VII --> subjects must have received only 1 prior line of therapy but remain naive to oxaliplatin prior to enrollment
Exclusion: 
MSH-H tumours; concurrent monoclonal antibody therapy: anti-EGFR or anti-VEGF

Unnamed: 1:
NUANCE

Optimizing Nutrition in patients with PDAC on chemo
Unnamed: 2:
Weekly / monthly calls with Dietician, Clinical Nurse Specialist and Social Worker 

QOL questionnaires at BL, 2 months and 6 months

Unnamed: 1:
OPCS Registry

All PDAC patients
Ontario Pancreas Cancer Study: Identifying genetic, environmental, and lifestyle causes of PDAC
Unnamed: 2: Questionnaire + one-time blood draw

Unnamed: 1:
HPB Banking Protocol

All PDAC patients going to surgery who are not enrolled in Prosper-PANC 

Advanced patients who are not eligible for Prosper-PANC but having a biopsy and investigator requests WGTS
Unnamed: 2: Fresh tumor collection for WGTS ± organoids

Unnamed: 1: Trial Name / Eligibility / Details

Unnamed: 1:
Platinum-Can

  COMPARING SECOND-LINE NABPLAGEM VS. NAB-PACLITAXEL/GEMCITABINE IN BRCA1/2 OR PALB2 MUTANT METASTATIC PANCREATIC DUCTAL ADENOCARCINOMA
Unnamed: 2:
Pre-Activation Pancreas Trials 
NABPLAGEM VS. NAB-PACLITAXEL/GEMCITABINE
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion: 
ECOG 0-2 
Histologic documentation of metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma,
adenosquamous carcinoma, carcinoma or acinar carcinoma

Pathogenic BRCA1/2 or PALB2 mutation (somatic or germline)
 
exclusion: 
No prior Cisplatin

Unnamed: 1:
WATCH-PC

Wearable Devices and Remote Toxicity Checks to Predict Health Outcomes in Pancreatic Cancer 

Diagnosis of epithelial pancreatic cancer, confirmed with biopsy or suspected based on review of imaging at the multi-disciplinary conference 

Plan for chemotherapy as part of treatment plan or ongoing treatment
Unnamed: 2:
Weekly questionnaires

FitBit Smartwatch
Unnamed: 3:
Rachel Ding: 437-990-4238
Dorian Facey: 437-779-7757

SIV - June 02
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion:
Diagnosis of epithelial pancreatic cancer, confirmed with biopsy or suspected based on
review of imaging at the multi-disciplinary conference
Plan for chemotherapy as part of treatment plan or ongoing treatment
Exclusion: 
Lack of an email address
Inability to fluently speak and read English, given the questionnaires will only be
developed in English at first because of resource constraints
Inability or unwillingness to adhere to the study procedures, at the discretion of the
investigator
Admitted as an inpatient at enrolment

Unnamed: 1:
PRISM-1 

A Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Double-Blind, Multicenter Phase 3 Trial of Quemliclustat and Chemotherapy Versus Placebo and Chemotherapy in Patients with Treatment Naïve Metastatic Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma
Unnamed: 2:
Arm A (Experimental Arm)
Doses and administration of quemliclustat, NP, and Gem will be administered using a 28-day cycle

Arm B (Comparator Arm)
Doses and administration of placebo, NP, and Gem will be administered using a 28-day cycle
Unnamed: 4:
Inclusion:
No prior treatment for metastatic PDAC
Prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant therapy allowed if >12 months ago
Prior palliative radiation allowed if completed ≥2 weeks before randomization and AEs resolved to ≤ Grade 1
Biliary stent/tube allowed if no active obstruction and AEs ≤ Grade 1
≥1 measurable lesion by CT/MRI (RECIST v1.1)
Adequate organ, marrow, and coagulation function
Exclusion:
Previously treated for locally advanced, unresectable PDAC.
History of brain metastases or leptomeningeal metastases.
Prior treatment with a CD73 antagonist or inhibitor.
